intro: Mikania bradei, commonly known as the tropical morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Mikania bradei is often found in disturbed areas and can be invasive in some regions.
